subject: Re: [junit] Avoiding Hard coded locations
msgSnippet: Why not just use relative directories ?  My project generally looks something like this: projectName src data classes Then, in my code, I simply refer to file
messageBody:
Why not just use "relative directories"? My project generally looks
something like this:

projectName
src
data
classes

Then, in my code, I simply refer to file "data/foobar"

I don't mean to be insulting, but this seems like a very simple issue.
